snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Wednesday, selections include the ways that digital technology changed business for Japanese electronics companies, videos on the Web from...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Wednesday, selections include the ways that digital technology changed business for Japanese electronics companies, videos on the Web from some of the first people to own Google Glass and a genealogy app from Iceland, whose 320,000 people are apparently all related in some manner.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Bus Finder App, and Tabletop PC
